news.title: Health Crisis Grows, Aid Groups Say
news.content: More than 10 children on average have lost one or both of their legs every day in Gaza since October 7, with many amputations performed without anesthesia, a charity said Sunday, underscoring the dire humanitarian situation in the Palestinian enclave following more than three months of Israeli bombardment.

news.title: Politics in Kenya
news.content: The politics of Kenya take place in a framework of a presidential representative democratic republic, whereby the president is both head of state and head of government, and of a multi-party system in accordance with a new constitution passed in 2010. Executive power is exercised by the executive

news.title: Candidates Who Missed 2023 KCPE To Join Form One, Take Qualifying Test Later
news.content: Candidates who did not sit their Kenya Certificate of Primary Education (KCPE) examinations last year will nonetheless join secondary schools this year, Education Cabinet Secretary Ezekiel Machogu announced on Monday.

news.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un Turns 40. Maybe.
news.content: The birth dates of Kim's father and grandfather, who preceded him as rulers, are national holidays in the authoritarian state
